alert.note: Alert for East Sweetwater County; Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; South Lincoln County; Star Valley; Upper Green River Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 22 at 4:35PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Sublette, central Lincoln and western Sweetwater Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 433 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from central Lincoln southeast into western Sweetwater County. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Calpet around 445 PM MDT. La Barge and Mount Wagner around 450 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Corral Creek Guard Station, Mount Coffin, Wyoming Peak, Middle Piney Lake, Green River, Big Piney, Marbleton, Lander Peak, Eden and Farson. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 76 and 108. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: East Sweetwater County; Flaming Gorge; Rock Springs and Green River; Salt River and Wyoming Ranges; South Lincoln County; Star Valley; Upper Green River Basin
